articles.description: England dodge the rain to take the vital wicket of Marnus Labuschagne but their Ashes hopes remain in the balance going into the final day of the fourth Test against Australia.
articles.title: Root strikes but Ashes hopes hang in the balance

articles.description: Brian Harman maintains his stranglehold on The Open at Royal Liverpool despite Jon Rahm's record round of 63.
articles.title: Harman takes five-shot lead into final round of Open

articles.description: Lewis Hamilton says it is an "extraordinary feeling" to be back on pole position in Hungary but can he convert it into a race win?
articles.title: Hamilton thrilled by 'epic' Hungarian GP pole

articles.description: BBC Sport takes a look at what to expect from day four of the Fifa Women's World Cup, with Sweden facing South Africa, Netherlands playing Portugal and France taking on Jamaica.
articles.title: Sweden, Netherlands & France play World Cup openers

articles.description: Watch highlights as England take the vital wicket of Marnus Labuschagne to keep their Ashes hopes alive after a rain-soaked day four of the fourth Test against Australia.
articles.title: England battle weather to keep Ashes hopes alive

articles.description: It may not have been a thrilling performance but England did what they needed to do in their opening Women's World Cup game against Haiti - win.
articles.title: Lionesses rusty and predictable but get job done

articles.description: Bruno Fernandes and Jadon Sancho score as Manchester United beat Premier League rivals Arsenal in front of 82,000 fans in New Jersey.
articles.title: Man Utd beat Arsenal in US friendly

articles.description: Scottie Scheffler, Jon Rahm and Rory McIlroy all feature in the selection of best shots from the third round of the Open Championship at Royal Liverpool.
articles.title: Scheffler, Rahm & McIlroy in day three's best shots at The Open

articles.description: Aston Villa sign France winger Moussa Diaby from Bayer Leverkusen for an undisclosed fee.
articles.title: Villa sign winger Diaby from Leverkusen

articles.description: PSG are accused of "moral harassment" after leaving Kylian Mbappe out of their pre-season tour, and the players' union could take legal action.
articles.title: PSG treatment of Mbappe criticised by union
